This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=GEOGREL.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-03T10:58:33Z Peter Hopkins 2015-02-03T10:58:22+00:00 2015-02-03T10:58:22+00:00 FW: Conference Announcement https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;134ea00b.1502 Revealing the Past, Securing the Future<br>25-27 March 2015<br>All Souls Bolton<br><br>The Churches Conservation Trust\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds conference will explore the interdependence of heritage sites and communities.<br>Revealing the Past, Securing the Future will bring together sector specialists and professionals to share learning on how high quality design and expert conservation can reimagine traditional buildings, enliven communities and secure the future of heritage sites.<br>The topic we will explore is: How do organisations and communities together find, nurture and develop sustainable, long-term community uses for our finest historic buildings?<br>You\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdll hear first-hand from experts from the Heritage Alliance, the Heritage Lottery [...] Gwyn Rowley 2015-01-19T17:00:15+00:00 2015-01-19T17:00:15+00:00 Re: CFP RGS-IBG - Geographies of Islamophobia https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;e5b078d6.1501 Dear Peter,Good to see that you are setting up this session.I will be in<br>the Middle East at that time,but please keep me posted.Best wishes,Gwyn,<br><br>On 19 January 2015 at 12:59, Peter Hopkins <Peter.Hopkins@newcastle.ac.uk><br>wrote:<br><br>> Dear all,<br>><br>> Call for papers for the RGS-IBG Annual Conference, Exeter, 2-4 September<br>> 2015<br>><br>> Sponsored by the Geographies of Justice Research Group<br>><br>> *Geographies of Islamophobia*<br>><br>> This session focuses on geographies of Islamophobia and the complex ways<br>> that people who are perceived to be of Muslim faith experience<br>> marginalisation, exclusion and discrimination in specific [...] Peter Hopkins 2015-01-19T12:59:59+00:00 2015-01-19T12:59:59+00:00 CFP RGS-IBG - Geographies of Islamophobia https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;3a32e01e.1501 Dear all,<br><br>Call for papers for the RGS-IBG Annual Conference, Exeter, 2-4 September 2015<br><br>Sponsored by the Geographies of Justice Research Group<br><br>Geographies of Islamophobia<br><br>This session focuses on geographies of Islamophobia and the complex ways that people who are perceived to be of Muslim faith experience marginalisation, exclusion and discrimination in specific places and at different times. We are interested in exploring the spatial patterning of Islamophobia, its relation to different spaces and times (including its relationship to the discipline of geography), its use in both policy-relevant and theoretical research, and the varying ways in which it is experienced, [...] Martina Topic 2015-01-06T23:21:07+00:00 2015-01-06T23:21:07+00:00 cfp_Second Interdisciplinary Conference on Religion in Everyday Lives, Vienna, March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;eefeb087.1501 *** with apologies for cross-posting ***<br><br>Centre for Research in Social sciences and Humanities<br><br>http://www.socialsciencesandhumanities.com<br><br>is inviting paper/panel proposals for<br><br>Second Interdisciplinary Conference on Religion in Everyday lives to be held in<br><br>Vienna, Austria, 21-22.03.2015.<br><br>Conference venue: ***** Hotel Le Meridien Wien, Opernring 13-15, A-1010, Vienna, Austria (Room Happy Green)<br><br>Religion is often discussed through the eyes of secularisation theory; however, there is no agreement on what secularisation is, or to what extent religion is present in our present lives even though religion is as influential as ever. Whether we understand secularisation as a decline of religious beliefs, privatization of [...] Peter Hemming 2014-10-31T18:17:00+00:00 2014-10-31T18:17:00+00:00 Final Reminder: 1 more paper sought for AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;dd9f7f6b.1410 Final Reminder: 1 more paper sought for double session at: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: "Education, Faith and Place"<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic [...] Peter Hemming 2014-10-29T08:45:05+00:00 2014-10-29T08:45:05+00:00 1 more paper sought for double session at AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;c0ad93ca.1410 1 more paper sought for double session at: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: "Education, Faith and Place"<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic schools in [...] Peter Hemming 2014-10-26T13:39:38+00:00 2014-10-26T13:39:38+00:00 FINAL Call for Papers AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;7a6e53a1.1410 FINAL Call for Papers: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: "Education, Faith and Place"<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic schools in Australia (Bugg & Gurran [...] Peter Hemming 2014-10-22T18:20:24+00:00 2014-10-22T18:20:24+00:00 2nd Call for Papers AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;990d8cc.1410 ?2nd Call for Papers: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: "Education, Faith and Place"<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic schools in Australia (Bugg & Gurran [...] Peter Hemming 2014-10-17T21:39:54+00:00 2014-10-17T21:39:54+00:00 Call for Papers AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;8d79e16d.1410 Call for Papers: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: "Education, Faith and Place"<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic schools in Australia (Bugg & Gurran 2011), [...] Dwyer, Claire 2014-10-10T11:04:17+00:00 2014-10-10T11:04:17+00:00 Recruiting for studentships and research associate: Design, Material Culture and popular creativity in suburban faith communities https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;b0925663.1410 We're now recruiting for a research associate and two fully funded PhD studentships for an AHRC funded project 'Design, material culture and popular creativity in suburban faith communities', led by Dr Claire Dwyer (UCL Geography) and Professor David Gilbert (RHUL Geography). This project explores the aesthetics of faith in suburbia and the material cultures and practices of diverse suburban faith communities focused on eight communities located in West London. The project team will include a post-doctoral research associate and two PhD students, one based at UCL and one based at RHUL. The project also involves artistic and practice-based collaboration involving [...] Justin Tse 2014-09-17T13:00:54-07:00 2014-09-17T13:00:54-07:00 AAG 2015 CFP: An Urban Other-Than-Europe https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;c10834c3.1409 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>2015 AAG Call for Papers<br><br>"An Urban Other-Than-Europe"<br><br>Organizers: Timur Hammond (UCLA) and Justin Tse (University of Washington)<br><br>This session seeks to bring together a diverse group of researchers who<br>set out to understand the 'urban' in terms other than those provided by<br>'Europe.' In particular, we ask three questions: First, how have<br>understandings of urbanity, urban governance, and urban form followed<br>alternative geographies than those suggested by logics of capitalism and<br>colonialism? Second, what other kinds of logics, imaginaries, and<br>materialities have remained unacknowledged in our explorations of<br>Eurocentric rationalities? And third, how do these alternative [...] Justin Tse 2014-09-17T12:23:21-07:00 2014-09-17T12:23:21-07:00 AAG 2015: GORABS Call for Paper Sessions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;17ea6fe4.1409 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>*Geography of Religions and Belief Systems*<br><br>*AAG 2015: Call for Paper Sessions*<br><br>**<br><br>The Geography of Religions and Belief Systems Specialty Group (GORABS)<br>of the Association of American Geographers (AAG) invites paper sessions<br>for sponsorship.<br><br>The purpose of GORABS is to sponsor sessions at the AAG that pertain to<br>the geography of religions and belief systems. Recent interest in<br>geographies of religion have revolved around how religious imaginations<br>and practices undergird contemporary geopolitics, social geographies of<br>sexuality and age, everyday cultural geographies, and spiritual belief<br>systems. Much effort has also gone into combatting Islamophobia by<br>unpacking everyday [...] Sophie Rudland 2014-07-03T13:48:20+00:00 2014-07-03T13:48:20+00:00 International Perspectives on Science, Culture and Society https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;7d2774a9.1407 Sophie Rudland (Commissioning Assistant, Pickering & Chatto Publishers) is now actively seeking proposals for innovative monographs and essay collections for our latest new series: International Perspectives on Science, Culture and Society www.pickeringchatto.com/ipscs<http://www.pickeringchatto.com/ipscs><br><br>This series seeks to build an understanding of the social and cultural context of religion, science, technology and medicine. The scope of the series includes studies relating to both historical and contemporary debates, the interplay between science and systems of belief, and all aspects of scientific research, its application and communication within diverse societies worldwide. It brings together insights from historians, philosophers and social scientists. [...] Justin Tse 2014-04-07T13:07:27-07:00 2014-04-07T13:07:27-07:00 GORABS Business Meeting Agenda https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOGREL;f9022a94.1404 Dear friends and colleagues:<br><br>I am looking forward to seeing many of you at the AAG in Tampa this week.<br><br>I am attaching the business meeting agenda for our GORABS business<br>meeting on Friday. I look forward to seeing as many of you as can make<br>it there!<br><br>Cheers,<br>Justin
